page.title: 10A New By-Pass for Newport
page.content: This{By-Pass}was opened on Tuesday 16th October 1984 in order to reduce the pressure of{traffic}travelling through Newport.It was built on the Eastern side of the town from South-East to North-West and measures four miles in lengh.The opening was to be a time of celebration for local school children but unfortunately rainfall was so heavy that Newport Junior School pupils and teachers had to return to school without seeing much of the opening.However an ox was still roasted in the town square and local people turned out in the evening to celebrate.In 1985 a{servey}of a half-hour time period was carried out by the Stafford rd roundabout. Cars S.East 47 , Cars N.West 55 Lorries S.East 55 , Lorries N.West 22 The distance of the{By-pass}is 4 miles long.
